thread.title: Baby boy hospitalized after being found unconscious in Glendale bathtub
thread.title_full: Baby boy hospitalized after being found unconscious in Glendale bathtub

author: @azfamily
title: Baby boy hospitalized after being found unconscious in Glendale bathtub
text:
Baby boy hospitalized after being found unconscious in Glendale bathtub A 12-month-old boy has been rushed to the hospital after an incident at a West Valley home. Michael Raimondi reports. By Ben Bradley Published: Feb. 20, 2025 at 4:35 PM MST | Updated: 47 minutes ago Email This Link
Share on Facebook
Share on X (formerly Twitter)
Share on Pinterest
Share on LinkedIn
GLENDALE, AZ (AZFamily) — A 1-year-old boy is hospitalized after nearly drowning in a bathtub in Glendale early Thursday afternoon.
Rescue crews responded to an apartment on Keim Drive, near 59th Avenue and Bethany Home Road , shortly after 2 p.m. for the report that a young boy had been found unconscious in a bathtub.
The boy was rushed to a hospital where his current condition is unknown.
According to Glendale police, the child’s mother had stepped away for a short amount of time before returning to find her son unresponsive.
Investigators did not say how long he had been left alone.
Police said they received multiple 911 calls but didn’t say who made them.
Police said it’s a sad reality that drowning calls happen when they are preventable.
“Watch your kids around water,” said Glendale Police Officer Moroni Mendez. “It doesn’t matter the amount of water. It could be in a pool. It could be in a bathtub. It could be in a five-gallon bucket.”
Other information was not immediately available.
Glendale police officers and fire crews responded to a home on Keim Drive shortly after 2 p.m. Thursday. (Arizona's Family) See a spelling or grammatical error in our story? Please click here to report it .
